I thought the article was extremely interesting.  I was a bit skeptical 
ab=
out the "blood rust" stuff and this chap owning the first Han 
Emperor's sw=
ord (dating from circa 200 B.C.).  Mr. Boyd seemed to be 
implying that the=
 greater part of the techniques used to produce 
Japanese swords were in us=
e in China in deep Antiquity.  I'd like to 
hear serious Nihonto experts re=
sponding to the article's claims.  (And 
how about those Vincents? Not one,=
 but two Vincents.)
